alert.note: Alert for Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 31 at 5:21AM CDT until March 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical fire weather conditions are expected Friday afternoon through early evening; and again Saturday Afternoon across Southwest portions of the area as a Fire Weather Watch has been issued... .The combination of northwest winds gusting up to 45 mph and relative humidity readings falling below 15 percent will create Critical fire weather conditions in the Red Flag Warning area for Friday. For Saturday, winds will be from the south at 15-25 mph gusting to 30 mph as relative humidity values fall below 15%. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 042... * Affected Area...In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 042 Wichita. * Timing...Noon MDT (1 PM CDT) through 7 PM MDT (8 PM CDT) Friday. * Winds...Northwest 30 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 11 percent. * Temperatures...Around 60. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
